title: Calculate Proper Water Intake
brief: Determine how much water to drink based on conditions and activity level.
steps: Step 1: Drink 2-3 liters daily under normal conditions at 20Â°C (68Â°F).
Step 2: Increase to 6-8 liters daily when food intake is low.
Step 3: In extreme heat, drink 14-30 liters daily (body can lose 2.5-3.5 liters per hour).
Step 4: Maintain urine output of at least 0.5 liters every 24 hours as a minimum.
Step 5: Drink small amounts regularly each hour rather than large amounts at once.
Step 6: Never drink more than 1 liter at a time for comfort.
warnings: In arid climates, the average person can lose 2.5-3.5 liters per hour.
Always drink water when eating - digestion requires water and can cause dehydration.
